clinical_study.brief_title: A Multiple-Dose Study of Oral Oseltamivir in Participants on Hemodialysis (HD) and Continuous Ambulatory Peritoneal Dialysis (CAPD)
clinical_study.official_title: A Single Center, Open Label, Multiple-Dose Oral Oseltamivir Suspension Study in End-Stage-Renal Disease (ESRD) Patients on Hemodialysis (HD) and Continuous Ambulatory Peritoneal Dialysis (CAPD)

brief_summary.textblock: This study is designed to assess the pharmacokinetics (PK) and safety of oseltamivir and its metabolite oseltamivir carboxylate in participants undergoing routine HD and CAPD for end-stage renal disease (ESRD). Participants will receive 6.5 and 6 weeks of the marketed oral oseltamivir suspension dosed according to the HD or CAPD schedule, respectively.

primary_outcome.measure: Maximum Plasma Concentration (Cmax) of Oseltamivir in HD Participants During Days 1 to 5
primary_outcome.time_frame: Blood samples 0, 1, 2, 4, 8, 12, 20, 32, 42, 48, 49, 90 hours from Day 1 (D1) dose
primary_outcome.description: Plasma samples were obtained up to 90 hours post-dose during the first dose analysis (Days 1 to 5), and the maximum observed concentration was recorded. The Cmax was averaged among all participants and expressed in nanograms per milliliter (ng/mL).

primary_outcome.measure: Cmax of Oseltamivir in HD Participants During Days 38 to 43
primary_outcome.time_frame: Blood samples 0, 1, 2, 4, 8, 12, 20, 32, 42, 48, 49, 90 hours from Day 38 (D38) dose
primary_outcome.description: Plasma samples were obtained up to 90 hours post-dose during the second dose analysis (Days 38 to 43), and the maximum observed concentration was recorded. The Cmax was averaged among all participants and expressed in ng/mL.

primary_outcome.measure: Cmax of Metabolite Oseltamivir Carboxylate in HD Participants During Days 1 to 5
primary_outcome.time_frame: Blood samples 0, 1, 2, 4, 8, 12, 20, 32, 42, 48, 49, 90 hours from D1 dose
primary_outcome.description: Plasma samples were obtained up to 90 hours post-dose during the first dose analysis (Days 1 to 5), and the maximum observed concentration was recorded. The Cmax was averaged among all participants and expressed in ng/mL.

primary_outcome.measure: Cmax of Metabolite Oseltamivir Carboxylate in HD Participants During Days 38 to 43
primary_outcome.time_frame: Blood samples 0, 1, 2, 4, 8, 12, 20, 32, 42, 48, 49, 90 hours from D38 dose
primary_outcome.description: Plasma samples were obtained up to 90 hours post-dose during the second dose analysis (Days 38 to 43), and the maximum observed concentration was recorded. The Cmax was averaged among all participants and expressed in ng/mL.

primary_outcome.measure: Area Under the Concentration-Time Curve (AUC) of Oseltamivir in HD Participants During Days 1 to 5
primary_outcome.time_frame: Blood samples 0, 1, 2, 4, 8, 12, 20, 32, 42, 48, 49, 90 hours from D1 dose
primary_outcome.description: Plasma samples were obtained up to 90 hours post-dose during the first dose analysis (Days 1 to 5), and the AUC was determined from 0 to 12 hours (AUC12) and up to the last measurable concentration (AUClast). Values were averaged among all participants and expressed in nanograms by hours per milliliter (ng*h/mL).

primary_outcome.description: Plasma samples were obtained up to 90 hours post-dose during the second dose analysis (Days 38 to 43), and the AUC12 and AUClast were determined. Values were averaged among all participants and expressed in ng*h/mL.

primary_outcome.measure: AUC of Metabolite Oseltamivir Carboxylate in HD Participants During Days 1 to 5
primary_outcome.time_frame: Blood samples 0, 1, 2, 4, 8, 12, 20, 32, 42, 48, 49, 90 hours from D1 dose
primary_outcome.description: Plasma samples were obtained up to 90 hours post-dose during the first dose analysis (Days 1 to 5), and the AUC was determined from 0 to 42 hours (AUC42) and up to the last measurable concentration (AUClast). Values were averaged among all participants and expressed in ng*h/mL.

secondary_outcome.measure: Plasma Concentration of Oseltamivir by Timepoint in HD Participants
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Blood samples 0, 1, 2, 4, 8, 12, 20, 32, 42, 48, 49 hours from D1 and D38 dose AND at 90 hours from D1 dose AND at 114 hours from D38 dose
secondary_outcome.description: Plasma samples were obtained up to 90 hours post-dose during the first dose analysis (Days 1 to 5) and up to 114 hours post-dose during the second dose analysis (Days 38 to 43). The concentration at each collection time was recorded and averaged among all participants and expressed in ng/mL.

secondary_outcome.measure: Plasma Concentration of Metabolite Oseltamivir Carboxylate by Timepoint in HD Participants
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Blood samples 0, 1, 2, 4, 8, 12, 20, 32, 42, 48, 49 hours from D1 and D38 dose AND at 90 hours from D1 dose AND at 114 hours from D38 dose
secondary_outcome.description: Plasma samples were obtained up to 90 hours post-dose during the first dose analysis (Days 1 to 5) and up to 114 hours post-dose during the second dose analysis (Days 38 to 43). The concentration at each collection time was recorded and averaged among all participants and expressed in ng/mL.

secondary_outcome.measure: Time to Maximum Plasma Concentration (Tmax) of Oseltamivir in HD Participants
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Blood samples 0, 1, 2, 4, 8, 12, 20, 32, 42, 48, 49, 90 hours from D1 and D38 dose
secondary_outcome.description: Plasma samples were obtained up to 90 hours post-dose during the first (Days 1 to 5) and second (Days 38 to 43) dose analyses, and the observed time of maximum concentration was recorded. The Tmax following each dose was averaged among all participants and expressed in hours.

secondary_outcome.measure: Tmax of Metabolite Oseltamivir Carboxylate in HD Participants
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Blood samples 0, 1, 2, 4, 8, 12, 20, 32, 42, 48, 49, 90 hours from D1 and D38 dose
secondary_outcome.description: Plasma samples were obtained up to 90 hours post-dose during the first (Days 1 to 5) and second (Days 38 to 43) dose analyses, and the observed time of maximum concentration was recorded. The Tmax following each dose was averaged among all participants and expressed in hours.

secondary_outcome.measure: Oral Plasma Clearance (CL/F) of Oseltamivir in HD Participants
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Blood samples 0, 1, 2, 4, 8, 12 hours from D1 and D38 dose
secondary_outcome.description: Plasma samples up to 12 hours post-dose during the first (Days 1 to 5) and second (Days 38 to 43) dose analyses were used to calculate apparent clearance adjusted for oral bioavailability. The CL/F with each dose was averaged among all participants and expressed in liters per hour (L/h).

secondary_outcome.measure: CL/F of Metabolite Oseltamivir Carboxylate in HD Participants
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Blood samples 0, 1, 2, 4, 8, 12, 20, 32, 42 hours from D1 and D38 dose
secondary_outcome.description: Plasma samples up to 42 hours post-dose during the first (Days 1 to 5) and second (Days 38 to 43) dose analyses were used to calculate apparent clearance adjusted for oral bioavailability. The CL/F with each dose was averaged among all participants and expressed in L/h.

secondary_outcome.measure: Renal Clearance (CLr) of Oseltamivir in HD Participants
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Blood samples 0, 1, 2, 4, 8, 12 hours from D1 dose; urine samples 0 to 12 hours from D1 dose
secondary_outcome.description: Plasma and urine samples up to 12 hours post-dose during the first dose analysis (Days 1 to 5) were used to calculate CLr, computed as [amount of drug excreted divided by the AUC12]. The CLr was averaged among all participants and expressed in L/h.

secondary_outcome.measure: CLr of Metabolite Oseltamivir Carboxylate in HD Participants
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Blood samples 0, 1, 2, 4, 8, 12, 20, 32, 42 hours from D1 dose; urine samples 0 to 42 hours from D1 dose
secondary_outcome.description: Plasma and urine samples up to 42 hours post-dose during the first dose analysis (Days 1 to 5) were used to calculate CLr, computed as [amount of metabolite excreted divided by the AUC42]. The CLr was averaged among all participants and expressed in L/h.

secondary_outcome.measure: Dialysis Clearance (CLd) of Metabolite Oseltamivir Carboxylate in HD Participants
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Blood samples 0, 1, 2, 4, 8, 12, 20, 32, 42, 48, 49, 90 hours from from D1 and D38 dose; dialyzer samples 1, 2, 4, 5 hours from start of dialysis on Days 3 and 40
secondary_outcome.description: Plasma samples up to 90 hours post-dose during the first (Days 1 to 5) and second (Days 38 to 43) dose analyses, in addition to dialyzer samples obtained on Days 3 and 40, were used to calculate CLd, computed as [amount of metabolite recovered in dialysate divided by the AUC over the dialysis interval]. The CLd with each dose was averaged among all participants and expressed in L/h.

secondary_outcome.measure: Percentage of Oseltamivir Dose Excreted as Unchanged Drug in HD Participants
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Urine samples 0 to 42 hours from D1 dose
secondary_outcome.description: Urine samples up to 42 hours post-dose during the first dose analysis (Days 1 to 5) were used to calculate drug excretion, computed as [amount of drug excreted divided by the oral oseltamivir dose] multiplied by 100. The value was averaged among all participants and expressed as a percent of the oseltamivir dose administered.

secondary_outcome.measure: Percentage of Oseltamivir Dose Excreted as Metabolite Oseltamivir Carboxylate in HD Participants
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Urine samples 0 to 42 hours from D1 dose
secondary_outcome.description: Urine samples up to 42 hours post-dose during the first dose analysis (Days 1 to 5) were used to calculate metabolite excretion, computed as [amount of metabolite excreted divided by the oral oseltamivir dose] multiplied by 100. The value was averaged among all participants and expressed as a percent of the oseltamivir dose administered.

secondary_outcome.measure: Plasma Concentration of Metabolite Oseltamivir Carboxylate in Arterial and Venous Blood by Timepoint in HD Participants
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Dialyzer samples 1, 2, 4, 5 hours from start of dialysis on Days 3 and 40
secondary_outcome.description: Dialyzer samples were obtained up to 5 hours from the start of dialysis on Days 3 and 40 (corresponding to HD sessions 2 and 18). Arterial concentrations were estimated using the inflow to the dialyzer, and venous concentrations were estimated using the outflow from the dialyzer. The concentration at each collection time was recorded and averaged among all participants and expressed in ng/mL.

secondary_outcome.measure: Plasma Concentration of Oseltamivir by Timepoint in CAPD Participants
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Blood samples 0, 1, 2, 4, 8, 12, 24, 48, 72, 120 hours from D1 and D36 dose AND at 168 hours from D36 dose

secondary_outcome.measure: Tmax of Oseltamivir in CAPD Participants

secondary_outcome.time_frame: Blood samples 0, 1, 2, 4, 8, 12, 24, 48, 72, 120 hours from D1 and D36 dose AND at 168 hours from D36 dose
secondary_outcome.description: Plasma samples were obtained up to 120 hours post-dose during the first dose analysis (Days 1 to 6) and up to 168 hours post-dose during the second dose analysis (Days 36 to 43), and the observed time of maximum concentration was recorded. The Tmax following each dose was averaged among all participants and expressed in hours.

secondary_outcome.measure: Elimination Rate Constant of Metabolite Oseltamivir Carboxylate in CAPD Participants
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Blood samples 0, 1, 2, 4, 8, 12, 24, 48, 72, 120 hours from D1 and D36 dose AND at 168 hours from D36 dose; urine samples 0 to 48 hours from D1 dose; dialysate samples 0 to 48 hours from D1 dose
secondary_outcome.description: Plasma samples were obtained up to 120 hours post-dose during the first dose analysis (Days 1 to 6) and up to 168 hours post-dose during the second dose analysis (Days 36 to 43). Urine and dialysate samples were also obtained up to 48 hours post-dose during the first dose analysis. The elimination rate constant was calculated as [natural log (ln)(2) divided by the half-life] and expressed as inverse hours (1/h).

secondary_outcome.measure: Terminal Elimination Half-Life of Metabolite Oseltamivir Carboxylate in CAPD Participants
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Blood samples 0, 1, 2, 4, 8, 12, 24, 48, 72, 120 hours from D1 and D36 dose AND at 168 hours from D36 dose; urine samples 0 to 48 hours from D1 dose; dialysate samples 0 to 48 hours from D1 dose
secondary_outcome.description: Plasma samples were obtained up to 120 hours post-dose during the first dose analysis (Days 1 to 6) and up to 168 hours post-dose during the second dose analysis (Days 36 to 43). Urine and dialysate samples were also obtained up to 48 hours post-dose during the first dose analysis. The time required for the concentration to decrease by one-half was recorded and averaged among all participants and expressed in hours.

secondary_outcome.measure: CL/F of Oseltamivir in CAPD Participants
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Blood samples 0, 1, 2, 4, 8, 12 hours from D1 and D36 dose
secondary_outcome.description: Plasma samples up to 12 hours post-dose during the first (Days 1 to 6) and second (Days 36 to 43) dose analyses were used to calculate apparent clearance adjusted for oral bioavailability. secondary_outcome.time_frame: Blood samples 0, 1, 2, 4, 8, 12, 24, 48 hours from D1 and D36 dose

secondary_outcome.time_frame: Blood samples 0, 1, 2, 4, 8, 12 hours from D1 dose; urine samples 0 to 12 hours from D1 dose
secondary_outcome.description: Plasma and urine samples up to 12 hours post-dose during the first dose analysis (Days 1 to 6) were used to calculate CLr, computed as [amount of drug excreted divided by the AUC12]. The CLr was averaged among all participants and expressed in L/h.

The CLd was averaged among all participants and expressed in L/h.

secondary_outcome.measure: Percentage of Oseltamivir Dose Renally Excreted as Unchanged Drug in CAPD Participants
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Urine samples 0 to 48 hours from D1 dose
secondary_outcome.description: Urine samples up to 48 hours post-dose during the first dose analysis (Days 1 to 6) were used to calculate renal excretion, computed as [amount of drug in urine divided by the oral oseltamivir dose] multiplied by 100. secondary_outcome.time_frame: Dialysate samples 0 to 48 hours from D1 dose
secondary_outcome.description: Dialysate samples up to 48 hours post-dose during the first dose analysis (Days 1 to 6) were used to calculate dialysis elimination, computed as [amount of drug in dialysate divided by the oral oseltamivir dose] multiplied by 100. The value was averaged among all participants and expressed as a percent of the oseltamivir dose administered.

secondary_outcome.measure: Percentage of Oseltamivir Dose Eliminated by Dialysis as Metabolite Oseltamivir Carboxylate in CAPD Participants

The value was averaged among all participants and expressed as a percent of the oseltamivir dose administered.

arm_group.description: Participants will receive 30 milligrams (mg) of oseltamivir via oral suspension approximately 1 hour after alternating HD sessions. Sessions will occur three times per week within the 6.5-week study period, and participants will receive a total of 9 doses of oseltamivir.

Participants will receive 30 mg of oseltamivir via oral suspension once weekly after dialysis exchange. CAPD sessions will occur four times every 24 hours, and participants will receive a total of 6 doses of oseltamivir within the 6-week study period.

intervention.description: Oseltamivir will be given as marketed oral suspension, 30 mg after HD or CAPD treatment.

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- Adults greater than or equal to (>/=) 18 years of age
- ESRD defined as no residual renal function or a creatinine clearance (CrCl) less than (<) 10 milliliters per minute (mL/min)
- Well established HD or CAPD therapy over a period of 3 months with stable CrCl < 10 mL/min
- Body mass index (BMI) 18 to 34 kilograms per meter-squared (kg/m^2)
- Use of contraception among women of childbearing potential
Exclusion Criteria:
- Clinical significant comorbid disease or terminal illness
- Known human immunodeficiency virus (HIV) or hepatitis B or C
- History of drug or alcohol abuse within the prior year
- Donation or loss of >/= 400 milliliters (mL) of blood in the 3 months prior to Screening
- Participation in a clinical study with an investigational drug in the 3 months prior to study drug
- Pregnant or lactating women

group.title: Oseltamivir With HD
group.description: Participants on hemodialysis (HD) received 9 doses of 30-milligram (mg) oseltamivir oral suspension, given 1 hour after completion of alternating HD sessions. All HD participants were planned to receive 19 routine HD sessions (three per week) during the 6.5-week study period.

group.title: Oseltamivir With CAPD
group.description: Participants on continuous ambulatory peritoneal dialysis (CAPD) received 6 doses of 30-mg oseltamivir oral suspension, given once weekly after dialysis exchange. All CAPD participants underwent routine CAPD sessions (four exchanges per 24 hours) during the 6-week study period.

participants_list.participants: None were prematurely withdrawn; 1 switched to CAPD mid-study and was excluded from second analysis.

baseline.population: All Enrolled: All participants enrolled into the study regardless of treatment received.

group.title: Oseltamivir With CAPD
group.description: Participants on CAPD received 6 doses of 30-mg oseltamivir oral suspension, given once weekly after dialysis exchange. All CAPD participants underwent routine CAPD sessions (four exchanges per 24 hours) during the 6-week study period.

outcome.description: Plasma samples were obtained up to 90 hours post-dose during the first dose analysis (Days 1 to 5) and up to 114 hours post-dose during the second dose analysis (Days 38 to 43). The concentration at each collection time was recorded and averaged among all participants and expressed in ng/mL.
outcome.time_frame: Blood samples 0, 1, 2, 4, 8, 12, 20, 32, 42, 48, 49 hours from D1 and D38 dose AND at 90 hours from D1 dose AND at 114 hours from D38 dose
outcome.population: PK Analysis Population; number (n) equals (=) number of participants included at specified timepoints in the analysis.

outcome.time_frame: Blood samples 0, 1, 2, 4, 8, 12, 20, 32, 42, 48, 49, 90 hours from D1 and D38 dose

outcome.title: Oral Plasma Clearance (CL/F) of Oseltamivir in HD Participants
outcome.description: Plasma samples up to 12 hours post-dose during the first (Days 1 to 5) and second (Days 38 to 43) dose analyses were used to calculate apparent clearance adjusted for oral bioavailability. The CL/F with each dose was averaged among all participants and expressed in liters per hour (L/h).
outcome.time_frame: Blood samples 0, 1, 2, 4, 8, 12 hours from D1 and D38 dose
outcome.population: PK Analysis Population; n = number of participants included in the specific dose analysis.

outcome.title: Renal Clearance (CLr) of Oseltamivir in HD Participants
outcome.description: Plasma and urine samples up to 12 hours post-dose during the first dose analysis (Days 1 to 5) were used to calculate CLr, computed as [amount of drug excreted divided by the AUC12]. The CLr was averaged among all participants and expressed in L/h.
outcome.time_frame: Blood samples 0, 1, 2, 4, 8, 12 hours from D1 dose; urine samples 0 to 12 hours from D1 dose

group.title: Oseltamivir With HD
group.description: Participants on HD received 9 doses of 30-mg oseltamivir oral suspension, given 1 hour after completion of alternating HD sessions. All HD participants were planned to receive 19 routine HD sessions (three per week) during the 6.5-week study period.

measure.title: Renal Clearance (CLr) of Oseltamivir in HD Participants
measure.description: Plasma and urine samples up to 12 hours post-dose during the first dose analysis (Days 1 to 5) were used to calculate CLr, computed as [amount of drug excreted divided by the AUC12]. The CLr was averaged among all participants and expressed in L/h.

outcome.title: CLr of Metabolite Oseltamivir Carboxylate in HD Participants
outcome.description: Plasma and urine samples up to 42 hours post-dose during the first dose analysis (Days 1 to 5) were used to calculate CLr, computed as [amount of metabolite excreted divided by the AUC42]. The CLr was averaged among all participants and expressed in L/h.
outcome.time_frame: Blood samples 0, 1, 2, 4, 8, 12, 20, 32, 42 hours from D1 dose; urine samples 0 to 42 hours from D1 dose

group.title: Oseltamivir With HD

measure.title: CLr of Metabolite Oseltamivir Carboxylate in HD Participants
measure.description: Plasma and urine samples up to 42 hours post-dose during the first dose analysis (Days 1 to 5) were used to calculate CLr, computed as [amount of metabolite excreted divided by the AUC42]. The CLr was averaged among all participants and expressed in L/h.

outcome.title: Dialysis Clearance (CLd) of Metabolite Oseltamivir Carboxylate in HD Participants
outcome.description: Plasma samples up to 90 hours post-dose during the first (Days 1 to 5) and second (Days 38 to 43) dose analyses, in addition to dialyzer samples obtained on Days 3 and 40, were used to calculate CLd, computed as [amount of metabolite recovered in dialysate divided by the AUC over the dialysis interval]. The CLd with each dose was averaged among all participants and expressed in L/h.
outcome.time_frame: Blood samples 0, 1, 2, 4, 8, 12, 20, 32, 42, 48, 49, 90 hours from from D1 and D38 dose; dialyzer samples 1, 2, 4, 5 hours from start of dialysis on Days 3 and 40
outcome.population: PK Analysis Population; n = number of participants included in the specific dose analysis.

group.title: Oseltamivir With HD
group.description: Participants on HD received 9 doses of 30-mg oseltamivir oral suspension, given 1 hour after completion of alternating HD sessions. All HD participants were planned to receive 19 routine HD sessions (three per week) during the 6.5-week study period.

measure.title: Dialysis Clearance (CLd) of Metabolite Oseltamivir Carboxylate in HD Participants
measure.description: Plasma samples up to 90 hours post-dose during the first (Days 1 to 5) and second (Days 38 to 43) dose analyses, in addition to dialyzer samples obtained on Days 3 and 40, were used to calculate CLd, computed as [amount of metabolite recovered in dialysate divided by the AUC over the dialysis interval]. The CLd with each dose was averaged among all participants and expressed in L/h.
measure.population: PK Analysis Population; n = number of participants included in the specific dose analysis.

outcome.title: Percentage of Oseltamivir Dose Excreted as Unchanged Drug in HD Participants
outcome.description: Urine samples up to 42 hours post-dose during the first dose analysis (Days 1 to 5) were used to calculate drug excretion, computed as [amount of drug excreted divided by the oral oseltamivir dose] multiplied by 100. The value was averaged among all participants and expressed as a percent of the oseltamivir dose administered.
outcome.time_frame: Urine samples 0 to 42 hours from D1 dose

outcome.title: Tmax of Oseltamivir in CAPD Participants
outcome.description: Plasma samples were obtained up to 120 hours post-dose during the first dose analysis (Days 1 to 6) and up to 168 hours post-dose during the second dose analysis (Days 36 to 43), and the observed time of maximum concentration was recorded. The Tmax following each dose was averaged among all participants and expressed in hours.
outcome.time_frame: Blood samples 0, 1, 2, 4, 8, 12, 24, 48, 72, 120 hours from D1 and D36 dose AND at 168 hours from D36 dose

measure.title: Tmax of Metabolite Oseltamivir Carboxylate in CAPD Participants

outcome.title: Elimination Rate Constant of Metabolite Oseltamivir Carboxylate in CAPD Participants
outcome.description: Plasma samples were obtained up to 120 hours post-dose during the first dose analysis (Days 1 to 6) and up to 168 hours post-dose during the second dose analysis (Days 36 to 43). Urine and dialysate samples were also obtained up to 48 hours post-dose during the first dose analysis. The elimination rate constant was calculated as [natural log (ln)(2) divided by the half-life] and expressed as inverse hours (1/h).
outcome.time_frame: Blood samples 0, 1, 2, 4, 8, 12, 24, 48, 72, 120 hours from D1 and D36 dose AND at 168 hours from D36 dose; urine samples 0 to 48 hours from D1 dose; dialysate samples 0 to 48 hours from D1 dose

outcome.title: CLr of Oseltamivir in CAPD Participants
outcome.description: Plasma and urine samples up to 12 hours post-dose during the first dose analysis (Days 1 to 6) were used to calculate CLr, computed as [amount of drug excreted divided by the AUC12]. The CLr was averaged among all participants and expressed in L/h.
outcome.time_frame: Blood samples 0, 1, 2, 4, 8, 12 hours from D1 dose; urine samples 0 to 12 hours from D1 dose

group.title: Oseltamivir With CAPD
group.description: Participants on CAPD received 6 doses of 30-mg oseltamivir oral suspension, given once weekly after dialysis exchange. All CAPD participants underwent routine CAPD sessions (four exchanges per 24 hours) during the 6-week study period.

outcome.title: CLr of Metabolite Oseltamivir Carboxylate in CAPD Participants
outcome.description: Plasma and urine samples up to 48 hours post-dose during the first dose analysis (Days 1 to 6) were used to calculate CLr, computed as [amount of metabolite excreted divided by the AUC48]. The CLr was averaged among all participants and expressed in L/h.
outcome.time_frame: Blood samples 0, 1, 2, 4, 8, 12, 24, 48 hours from D1 dose; urine samples 0 to 48 hours from D1 dose

group.title: Oseltamivir With CAPD
group.description: Participants on CAPD received 6 doses of 30-mg oseltamivir oral suspension, given once weekly after dialysis exchange. All CAPD participants underwent routine CAPD sessions (four exchanges per 24 hours) during the 6-week study period.

measure.title: CLr of Metabolite Oseltamivir Carboxylate in CAPD Participants
measure.description: Plasma and urine samples up to 48 hours post-dose during the first dose analysis (Days 1 to 6) were used to calculate CLr, computed as [amount of metabolite excreted divided by the AUC48]. The CLr was averaged among all participants and expressed in L/h.

outcome.title: CLd of Metabolite Oseltamivir Carboxylate in CAPD Participants
outcome.description: Plasma samples up to 120 hours and dialysate samples up to 48 hours post-dose during the first dose analysis (Days 1 to 6) were used to calculate CLd, computed as [amount of metabolite recovered in dialysate divided by the AUC over the dialysis interval]. The CLd was averaged among all participants and expressed in L/h.
outcome.time_frame: Blood samples 0, 1, 2, 4, 8, 12, 24, 48, 72, 120 hours from D1 dose; dialysate samples 0 to 48 hours from D1 dose

group.title: Oseltamivir With CAPD
group.description: Participants on CAPD received 6 doses of 30-mg oseltamivir oral suspension, given once weekly after dialysis exchange. All CAPD participants underwent routine CAPD sessions (four exchanges per 24 hours) during the 6-week study period.

measure.title: CLd of Metabolite Oseltamivir Carboxylate in CAPD Participants
measure.description: Plasma samples up to 120 hours and dialysate samples up to 48 hours post-dose during the first dose analysis (Days 1 to 6) were used to calculate CLd, computed as [amount of metabolite recovered in dialysate divided by the AUC over the dialysis interval]. The CLd was averaged among all participants and expressed in L/h.

outcome.title: Percentage of Oseltamivir Dose Renally Excreted as Unchanged Drug in CAPD Participants
outcome.description: Urine samples up to 48 hours post-dose during the first dose analysis (Days 1 to 6) were used to calculate renal excretion, computed as [amount of drug in urine divided by the oral oseltamivir dose] multiplied by 100. The value was averaged among all participants and expressed as a percent of the oseltamivir dose administered.
outcome.time_frame: Urine samples 0 to 48 hours from D1 dose
